com.logitopia.jmortar.core.object.util.impl

Class ParameterValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.logitopia.jmortar.core.object.util.impl.ParameterValidator

  • public class ParameterValidator
extends java.lang.Object
    The ParameterValidator class is an implementation of a static utility that validates parameters passed to a given method. It will check that the parameters passed for issues like, null values and empty strings.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static org.slf4j.Logger LOG
      The logger for this class.
      static byte NULL_VALIDATE
      Indicates that a check for null parameter is required.
      static byte STR_EMPTY_VALIDATE
      Indicates that a check for an empty String parameter is required.

    • Method Detail

      • validateParameters

        public static final void validateParameters(byte[] testTypes,
                                            java.lang.Object[] parameters,
                                            java.lang.String[] parameterNames,
                                            boolean throwExceptions,
                                            java.lang.Class clazz,
                                            java.lang.String methodName)
        Validate the parameters passed.
        Parameters:
        testTypes - The type of validation checks to carry out.
        parameters - The parameters to carry out the checks on.
        parameterNames - The names of the parameters that are being checked.
        throwExceptions - Should exceptions be thrown if values are missing.
        clazz - The class containing the method being validated.
        methodName - The name of the method being validated.
